title: Week Review: Lujvo Mastery
goal: Demonstrate mastery of rafsi, lujvo, and compound word concepts.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Quick recall — all 8 new words:

brivla → ?     glibau → ?
cmavo → ?      selsku → ?
lujvo → ?      seljmi → ?
jbobau → ?     terdi → ?

(Answers: predicate word, English, structure word, what is said, compound word, what is understood, Lojban, Earth)

Grammar Summary (3-4 min)

What You Learned This Week

1. Rafsi

  • Short combining forms of gismu
  • Used to build compound words
  • Each gismu has 2-5 rafsi

2. Lujvo

  • Compound words built from rafsi
  • Fixed, standardized meanings
  • "Frozen tanru"

3. The y-Hyphen

  • Buffer to prevent invalid consonant clusters
  • Makes lujvo pronounceable

4. sel-/ter-/vel- Pattern

  • Fuses conversion with gismu
  • selsku = se + cusku = what is said

5. Week 12 Vocabulary (8)

Lojban English Lojban English
brivla predicate word glibau English
cmavo structure word selsku what is said
lujvo compound word seljmi what is understood
jbobau Lojban terdi Earth

Self-Test (5-6 min)

Part A: Vocabulary (8 points)

Translate to English:

  1. brivla →
  2. jbobau →
  3. selsku →
  4. terdi →

Translate to Lojban:

  1. structure word →
  2. compound word →
  3. English (language) →
  4. what is understood →
Answers
  1. predicate word
  2. Lojban
  3. what is said
  4. Earth
  5. cmavo
  6. lujvo
  7. glibau
  8. seljmi

Part B: Lujvo Analysis (9 points)

Decompose these lujvo:

  1. jbobau = ? + ?
  2. brivla = ? + ?
  3. selsku = ? + ?

What gismu do these rafsi come from?

  1. jbo → ?
  2. bau → ?
  3. sku → ?

True or False:

  1. Lujvo have fixed meanings.
  2. Tanru have fixed meanings.
  3. Rafsi are used to build lujvo.
Answers
  1. jbo + bau
  2. briv + la
  3. sel + sku
  4. lojbo
  5. bangu
  6. cusku
  7. True
  8. False (tanru are contextual)
  9. True

Part C: Sentences (8 points)

Translate:

  1. I speak Lojban.
  2. This is a predicate word.
  3. Earth is big.
  4. I understand what is said.
Answers
  1. mi tavla fo la jbobau
  2. ti brivla
  3. la terdi cu barda
  4. mi jimpe lo selsku

Integration Challenge (1-2 min)

Discuss Lojban Using Lojban

Use at least:

  • jbobau, glibau
  • brivla, cmavo, lujvo
  • A complete thought about learning

Example:

mi tadni la jbobau
.i mi cilre lo brivla .e lo cmavo
.i la jbobau cu xamgu
.i mi gleki

(I study Lojban. I learn predicates and particles. Lojban is good. I am happy.)

Create your own and say it aloud.

Week 12 Complete Reference

Vocabulary (8):

Lojban English Lojban English
brivla predicate word glibau English
cmavo structure word selsku what is said
lujvo compound word seljmi what is understood
jbobau Lojban terdi Earth

Key Concepts:

Term Meaning
rafsi Short combining forms
lujvo Compound word (frozen tanru)
y-hyphen Buffer for consonant clusters
sel-/ter-/vel- Conversion prefixes in lujvo

Cumulative vocabulary: 106 words

Summary

You completed Week 12 on rafsi and lujvo. You can now recognize and decompose compound words, and understand the difference between lujvo and tanru.

Congratulations

do mo'u cilre lo jicmu be la jbobau

(You have finished learning the basics of Lojban!)

Twelve weeks complete.

You have learned:

  • 106 vocabulary words
  • Bridi structure (selbri + sumti)
  • Place structures (x1, x2, x3, x4, x5)
  • Conversions (se, te, ve, xe)
  • Place tags (fa, fe, fi, fo, fu)
  • Tanru (compound concepts)
  • Tanru grouping (bo, ke...ke'e)
  • Lujvo (frozen compounds)

What's Next?

Your Lojban journey continues:

  • Read Lojban texts
  • Practice with speakers
  • Learn more grammar (abstractions, relative clauses, tenses)
  • Build vocabulary
  • Join the Lojban community

.ui mi'e la .lojban. .i co'o

(Yay! I am Lojban. Goodbye!)
